thread.section_title: WBSM - New Bedford's Local Source For News, Talk, and Sports!
thread.title: Chief: New Bedford Police Doing Their Job
thread.title_full: Chief: New Bedford Police Doing Their Job

author: Jim Phillips
title: Chief: New Bedford Police Doing Their Job
text:
Chief: New Bedford Police Doing Their Job By Jim Phillips September 30, 2015 9:25 PM Share on Twitter Getty Images 
The Federal Bureau of Investigations says New Bedford is the most violent community in Massachusetts with 12.6 violent crimes in 2014 per one-thousand people. 
Police Chief David Provencher says while New Bedford has seen its share of violent crimes, the FBI and the city use different methods to measure crime. 
Several weeks ago, the city announced that crime had dropped 13% over the first seven months of 2015, compared to the same period last year. 
Provencher says the numbers give a better picture of what’s happening “right now.” 
While conceeding that the FBI numbers should not be ignored, the Chief says New Bedford Police are doing their job, preventing crimes and saving lives.
